verses.kjv: Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea, as the LORD spake unto me: and we compassed mount Seir many days.
verses.ct: Then we turned around and headed into the wilderness along the route toward the Red Sea, just as the LORD had told me. We traveled around Mount Seir for a long time.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD said to me,

verses.kjv: Ye have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you northward.
verses.ct: 'You've been circling this mountain long enough. Head north now.

verses.kjv: And command thou the people, saying, Ye are to pass through the coast of your brethren the children of Esau, which dwell in Seir; and they shall be afraid of you: take ye good heed unto yourselves therefore:
verses.ct: Give the people these instructions: You are about to pass through the territory of your relatives, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. They will be afraid of you, so be very careful.

verses.kjv: Meddle not with them; for I will not give you of their land, no, not so much as a foot breadth; because I have given mount Seir unto Esau for a possession.
verses.ct: Don't provoke them, because I'm not giving you any of their land — not even a single footstep of it. I have given Mount Seir to Esau as his own territory.

verses.kjv: Ye shall buy meat of them for money, that ye may eat; and ye shall also buy water of them for money, that ye may drink.
verses.ct: Pay them with silver for food to eat, and pay them with silver for water to drink.'

verses.kjv: For the LORD thy God hath blessed thee in all the works of thy hand: he knoweth thy walking through this great wilderness: these forty years the LORD thy God hath been with thee; thou hast lacked nothing.
verses.ct: The LORD your God has blessed you in everything you've done. He has watched over your journey through this vast wilderness. For these 40 years, the LORD your God has been with you, and you haven't gone without anything.

verses.kjv: And when we passed by from our brethren the children of Esau, which dwelt in Seir, through the way of the plain from Elath, and from Eziongaber, we turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of Moab.
verses.ct: So we passed by our relatives, the descendants of Esau who lived in Seir. We left the road through the Arabah valley that runs from Elath and Eziongaber, and turned to travel along the road through the wilderness of Moab.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Distress not the Moabites, neither contend with them in battle: for I will not give thee of their land for a possession; because I have given Ar unto the children of Lot for a possession.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, 'Don't harass the Moabites or provoke them into war, because I'm not giving you any of their land as your own. I have given Ar to the descendants of Lot as their territory.'

verses.kjv: The Emims dwelt therein in times past, a people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims;
verses.ct: (The Emims had previously lived there — a large, numerous, and tall people, like the Anakims.

verses.kjv: Which also were accounted giants, as the Anakims; but the Moabites call them Emims.
verses.ct: They were also considered giants, like the Anakims, but the Moabites called them Emims.

verses.kjv: The Horims also dwelt in Seir beforetime; but the children of Esau succeeded them, when they had destroyed them from before them, and dwelt in their stead; as Israel did unto the land of his possession, which the LORD gave unto them.
verses.ct: The Horims had also previously lived in Seir, but the descendants of Esau drove them out, destroyed them, and settled in their place — just as Israel did with the land the LORD gave them as their own territory.)

verses.kjv: Now rise up, said I, and get you over the brook Zered. And we went over the brook Zered.
verses.ct: 'Now get moving and cross the Zered Valley.' So we crossed the Zered Valley.

verses.kjv: And the space in which we came from Kadeshbarnea, until we were come over the brook Zered, was thirty and eight years; until all the generation of the men of war were wasted out from among the host, as the LORD sware unto them.
verses.ct: The time from when we left Kadeshbarnea until we crossed the Zered Valley was 38 years. By then, the entire generation of fighting men had died off from the camp, just as the LORD had sworn would happen.

verses.kjv: For indeed the hand of the LORD was against them, to destroy them from among the host, until they were consumed.
verses.ct: Indeed, the LORD's power worked against them to eliminate them from the camp until every last one was gone.

verses.kjv: So it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people,
verses.ct: When all the fighting men among the people had finally died off,

verses.kjv: That the LORD spake unto me, saying,
verses.ct: the LORD said to me,

verses.kjv: Thou art to pass over through Ar, the coast of Moab, this day:
verses.ct: 'Today you are crossing through Ar, the border region of Moab.

verses.kjv: And when thou comest nigh over against the children of Ammon, distress them not, nor meddle with them: for I will not give thee of the land of the children of Ammon any possession; because I have given it unto the children of Lot for a possession.
verses.ct: When you get near the territory of the Ammonites, don't harass them or provoke them, because I'm not giving you any of the Ammonites' land as your own. I have given it to the descendants of Lot as their territory.'

verses.kjv: (That also was accounted a land of giants: giants dwelt therein in old time; and the Ammonites call them Zamzummims;
verses.ct: (That region was also considered a land of giants. Giants had lived there in ancient times, and the Ammonites called them Zamzummims —

verses.kjv: A people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims; but the LORD destroyed them before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead:
verses.ct: a large, numerous, and tall people, like the Anakims. But the LORD wiped them out ahead of the Ammonites, who then drove them out and settled in their place,

verses.kjv: As he did to the children of Esau, which dwelt in Seir, when he destroyed the Horims from before them; and they succeeded them, and dwelt in their stead even unto this day:
verses.ct: just as he did for the descendants of Esau who live in Seir, when he wiped out the Horims ahead of them. They drove them out and have lived in their place to this day.

verses.kjv: And the Avims which dwelt in Hazerim, even unto Azzah, the Caphtorims, which came forth out of Caphtor, destroyed them, and dwelt in their stead.)
verses.ct: The same thing happened with the Avims, who had lived in villages as far as Azzah. The Caphtorims, who came from Caphtor, destroyed them and settled in their place.)

verses.kjv: Rise ye up, take your journey, and pass over the river Arnon: behold, I have given into thine hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land: begin to possess it, and contend with him in battle.
verses.ct: 'Get up, break camp, and cross the Arnon River. Look — I am handing over to you Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, along with his land. Start taking possession of it and engage him in battle.

verses.kjv: This day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of thee upon the nations that are under the whole heaven, who shall hear report of thee, and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of thee.
verses.ct: Starting today, I will cause the nations everywhere under heaven to dread and fear you. When they hear reports about you, they will tremble and be filled with anxiety because of you.'

verses.kjv: And I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth unto Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,
verses.ct: From the wilderness of Kedemoth, I sent messengers to Sihon king of Heshbon with a peaceful proposal, saying,

verses.kjv: Let me pass through thy land: I will go along by the high way, I will neither turn unto the right hand nor to the left.
verses.ct: 'Let me pass through your land. I will stay on the main road and won't turn off to the right or the left.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt sell me meat for money, that I may eat; and give me water for money, that I may drink: only I will pass through on my feet;
verses.ct: Sell me food for silver so I can eat, and sell me water for silver so I can drink. Just let me walk through on foot —

verses.kjv: (As the children of Esau which dwell in Seir, and the Moabites which dwell in Ar, did unto me;) until I shall pass over Jordan into the land which the LORD our God giveth us.
verses.ct: the same way the descendants of Esau living in Seir and the Moabites living in Ar allowed me to do — until I cross the Jordan into the land that the LORD our God is giving us.'

verses.kjv: But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the LORD thy God hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, that he might deliver him into thy hand, as appeareth this day.
verses.ct: But Sihon king of Heshbon refused to let us pass through, because the LORD your God had made his spirit stubborn and his heart defiant, in order to hand him over to you — as you can see today.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Behold, I have begun to give Sihon and his land before thee: begin to possess, that thou mayest inherit his land.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, 'Look, I have already begun giving Sihon and his land over to you. Start taking possession of his land now.'

verses.kjv: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to fight at Jahaz.
verses.ct: Then Sihon marched out with his entire army to fight against us at Jahaz.

verses.kjv: And the LORD our God delivered him before us; and we smote him, and his sons, and all his people.
verses.ct: The LORD our God gave us victory over him, and we struck down him, his sons, and all his forces.

verses.kjv: And we took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed the men, and the women, and the little ones, of every city, we left none to remain:
verses.ct: At that time we captured all his cities and completely destroyed every city — men, women, and children. We left no survivors.

verses.kjv: Only the cattle we took for a prey unto ourselves, and the spoil of the cities which we took.
verses.ct: We kept only the livestock as plunder for ourselves, along with the goods from the cities we captured.

verses.kjv: From Aroer, which is by the brink of the river of Arnon, and from the city that is by the river, even unto Gilead, there was not one city too strong for us: the LORD our God delivered all unto us:
verses.ct: From Aroer on the edge of the Arnon River valley, including the city in the valley itself, all the way to Gilead, not a single city was too fortified for us. The LORD our God handed them all over to us.

verses.kjv: Only unto the land of the children of Ammon thou camest not, nor unto any place of the river Jabbok, nor unto the cities in the mountains, nor unto whatsoever the LORD our God forbad us.
verses.ct: But you did not go near the land of the Ammonites, or anywhere along the Jabbok River, or the cities in the hill country, or any place that the LORD our God had told us to avoid.
